DataElement.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Related Genitalia Edema Symptom Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of symptom (an indication that a person has a condition or disease) of Kaposi Sarcoma (a malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells) related to genitalia (the external sex organs) edema (pathological transudate within one or more tissues)

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Related Genitalia Edema Symptom
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to a symptom (an indication that a person has a condition or disease) of Kaposi Sarcoma (a malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells) related genitalia (the external sex organs) edema (pathological transudate within one or more tissues).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin however, it may also occur internally.  It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).:Related; connected or associated.:The external sex organs.:Pathological transudate within one or more tissues.(FMA)

Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.
Accumulation of an excessive amount of fluid in cells or intercellular tissues.

Property.preferredDefinition: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
